Document.Content:
urn:contentItem:3SP2-F3S0-009B-H16P-00000-00s. africa recognizes zairean new president1997-05-19T00:00:00Z2020-08-04T18:48:16ZLexisNexiss. africa recognizes zairean new presidentjohannesburg, may 19; ITEM NO: 0519065

south africa has recognized laurent kabila as the president of "the democratic republic of the congo", local daily the citizen quoted deputy president thabo mbeki as saying today. mbeki made the announcement in lubumbashi after meeting with kabila over the future of this vast central african country, otherwise known as zaire. kabila proclaimed himself president saturday, renaming zaire the democratic republic of the congo and announced that a government of national salvation would be formed by may 20 and an assembly be convened to draft a new constitution within two months. mbeki said he was satisfied that the transitional government would be broad-based. "it is important during this transitional period that the people should enjoy democratic rights and democratic freedom. "the approach of the alliance to this question is indeed that. it is itself an alliance of democratic forces," he said. mbeki, an active participant in the negotiations that led up to kabila's taking power, was the first foreign dignitary to see kabila since he declared himself president. he spent about two hours with kabila in lubumbashi, the temporary headquarters of kabila's alliance of democratic forces for the liberation of congo-zaire.
